parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "strumpack",
"details": {
"scheduler": "slurm",
"job_name": "strumpack@6.1.0",
"account": "sdsc",
"partition": "hotel",
"nodes": 1,
"tasks_per_node": 1,
"cpus_per_task": 10,
"memory": "93G",
"gpus": 1,
"time": "01:00:00",
"spack_version": "0.17.3",
"spack_instance_name": "gpu",
"spack_instance_dir": "${HOME}/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/gpu",
"spack_package": "strumpack@6.1.0",
"spack_compiler": "gcc@10.2.0",
"spack_variants": "+butterflypack +c_interface ~count_flops ~cuda ~ipo +mpi ~openmp +parmetis ~rocm ~scotch +shared +slate ~task_timers +zfp",
"spack_dependencies": "^butterflypack@2.0.0/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' butterflypack@2.0.0 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^slate@2021.05.02/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' slate@2021.05.02 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@4.1.3)"
}
}
```
This script installs the strumpack package using the spack package manager. It is configured to run on a slurm cluster and requires 1 node with 1 task and 10 cpus per task, 93 GB of memory, and 1 GPU. The script utilizes a pre-configured spack instance named 'gpu'. The script uses spack's spec command to define the required dependencies, including butterflypack and slate. It then utilizes spack's install command to install the package and refresh the lmod modules after installation. Finally, it waits for 60 seconds before proceeding.
